page.title: 05Farming
page.content: There are different types of farms in the area. Some are almost entirely for fruit - apples pears + some cherries. Many of the good old varieties have been grubbed out, Worcester, Beauty of Bath, Millers seedling. One large farm is mostly arable, cabbage, beans, potatoes, strawberries with chemical fertilisers. There are mixed farms, growing blackcurrants, gooseberries, asparagus, watercress as well as cattle. To the north a mixed farm with Sussex reds, arable,cereal and orchards. No stubble is burnt, the straw is used for the cattle + ploughed back, areas are left wild, traditional but very efficient. This farm also incorporates chestnut coppice. Other crops grown in the area include brassicas, peas, beans, sweet corn, barley and clover.
